file_content.text: I assume you've settled in?
I hope we make space journeys many, Chief. I love the boom of engines, the screech of hyperspace. Good noises. Legendary sounds.
My homeworld has no starships. My people live in the trees, close to the sky, but the stars endless remain out of reach always.
I am alone among my people. No other has flown a starship. That is how I left my homeworld and came here.
You flew a starship by yourself? How did you even get ahold of one if your homeworld doesn't have any?
What an impressive feat.
It was not easy, but it is a good tale. I will tell you.
I don't know anything about your homeworld or its people. What are they like?
Tell me about your people.
Home is beautiful. There are mountains few and trees endless. My people are peaceful gatherers, weavers and builders. I had to leave.
Fly a starship? You can barely dress yourself. How did you reach the control panel--by sitting on a box?
Don't make me laugh.
Yes, exactly--cargo box. Good guess.
I still remember seeing the starship. It roared like a Gorax in the sky, trailing smoke and flame. I followed. It was my fate.
I found the crew fixing their broken starship. I offered help, but they shot at me and laughed. After nights many, I finally killed them all and claimed their starship.
Your foes deserved nothing less than death. Your only mistake was offering them help in the first place.
I approve. Never show mercy.
Now I only help when I am paid. It is a good policy--easy to remember.
Good. They earned their fates. There's no excuse for rudeness.
It was the right thing to do.
The shooting did not bother me, but the laughing was too far.
Well done. Patience and cunning are virtues in my line of work.
I admire your tenacity.
I hunted foes many on my homeworld. No kills made me happier than these.
We have the same approach to solving problems. The only difference is, I would have wiped them out much faster.
I would have done the same.
Traps and lures are slow to build. I learned from that experience. Now, I rush in and overwhelm foes quickly.
If you wiped out the whole crew, who was left to repair the vessel so you could leave?
How did you fix the ship?
You hunted down the entire crew over several nights? I bet those final logs were great. "The furry thing--it's coming for us again!"
You killed them? Hilarious!
Yes, they sounded just like that! Do you know this tale already?
The ship droid was smart. It surrendered, finished repairs, and taught me the controls. Then I flew into space! Zoom to fate!
I landed on a world of terrible smells endless. They call it Nar Shaddaa. I found strong allies and Imperial jobs many to attack Republic targets. Good days.
Those friends of yours--who were they? Why did they attack Republic targets on Nar Shaddaa?
Tell me about these allies.
Clan Ordo--Mandalorian warriors. They gave me food, taught me fighting, and let me charge into battle ahead of them.
Since you aren't flying around the galaxy on your own, I assume you lost that starship you captured.
Do you still have that ship?
Yes, my transport is long gone after a crash. But it served its purpose.
Nar Shaddaa eats little things like you alive. You're lucky you didn't wind up a slave--or worse.
I'm amazed you survived.
A Nikto slaver put a shock collar on me. Big mistake. He regretted it.
Fate brought the starship and Nar Shaddaa to me. Now, fate brings you and your mission.
On my homeworld, I am a legend. But now, my tale spreads to the stars. We go, Chief!
What's on your mind?
I have made a choice. I will not seek a new chief. There is none better than you.
I am only sorry I cannot serve you to your final breath. Your people live seasons many more than mine. But I will fight for you to my last day.
You have served me well, and will continue to do so until our time together ends. That is all I can ask of you.
You are a valued ally.
Do not worry, Chief. I will not leave your side.
What will I do when you're gone, Treek? You're one of my only allies I can truly trust.
I will miss you.
You are fated for greatness. There will be others who serve you with loyalty.
None of us knows how long we've got. That's what makes life interesting--and well worth fighting for. Have fun while it lasts, Treek.
Until then, we'll fight hard.
You understand. This is why we seek challenges every day.
You may be the most earnest and open-hearted operative in my employ. Your commitment and honesty will be irreplaceable.
I value your loyalty.
Then you will remember me? That brings relief.
How many years do members of your species usually live?
How long do you have?
I cannot say with truth. We do not count time like you. Your people live seasons many. Mine only live seasons few.
Nobody expects their pets to outlive them. I'll make arrangements to replace you when the time comes.
No great loss for me.
But you will remember me, and hold the replacement to my standard?
We still have time for great things many. Foes will fall, and we will make legendary tales together. I hope they last.
I do not know what will become of my name after I am gone. Without someone to recite my victories many, the memories many will fade. I will be forgotten.
We can keep your name alive forever. Everything you've ever done can be stored on the HoloNet as data. I'll show you.
Put it on the HoloNet.
There is much on your HoloNet that no one appreciates. We must set reminders for everyone.
Teach me how to recite your tale, and I'll teach it to others. No one will forget you, I promise.
I'll keep your legend alive.
You would do this for me? I am honored endless.
Nothing lasts forever, and everything dies--even our names. There's no point resisting it.
That's life. Get used to it.
Sith build monuments many to their legends. I ask only for songs.
You celebrate your Great Hunt winners. What I ask is no different.
You choose to fade away, Chief. I would choose tribute.
When I am gone, all that is mine becomes yours. Give those things to those who follow me.
My fate is sealed. I have regrets none. We go!
You wanted to speak?
I must pay you proper respect, Chief. You are a great warrior--maybe the greatest ever. I have seen it times endless.
You fear nothing. You sweep away all enemies in your path with powers many. If I had your Force, victories endless I would have!
You would be a good apprentice. I would teach you to focus your rage into a weapon, and burn away your compassion for others.
I would train you.
That is good advice, Chief. I will work on those tasks and hope the power comes to me.
You, wielding the Force? The expressions of terrified incredulity alone would be worth it.
I would enjoy seeing that.
I would be your greatest apprentice, Chief. That is certain.
You surprise your enemies with tricks many. By the time your foes know what you have done, they are dead. I need more devices like yours.
You don't need a bag of tricks. I'm pretty sure the Empire already has you registered as a living superweapon.
I think you're tough enough.
You think so, Chief? That makes me happy.
People like me can do their jobs because people like you attract all the attention. I wouldn't have it any other way.
You're the perfect partner.
I am glad you find me useful, Chief. I will remember to be louder in battle.
Don't try to be more than what you are. When I have complaints with your efforts, you'll know.
Stick to what you know.
I have seen you express disappointment with others many. I will not wind up like them.
No matter how good you get, I will always be better. Never forget that.
You'll never outshine me.
Of course! You are chief. If I were better than you, I would be chief. That would be wrong. Things are better this way.
This war is not like anything on my homeworld. When the people fight, it is for food or good land. Small battles, simple goals.
My homeworld's fights end quickly and are forgotten, but here, they are battles endless. Do you think the Empire will take mercy on the Republic and offer peace?
The Sith will only accept the Republic's unconditional surrender. They still owe us a few millennia of slavery for what they did to us.
There will be no mercy.
I do not think the Republic people wish to pay that debt.
The Republic is led by Jedi fools who will never submit to Sith authority. They'll fight to the death, and we'll be forced to give it to them.
Jedi won't give us the choice.
Maybe the Republic people will kill the Jedi in self-defense? It could happen.
There's not much work for hunters in peacetime. What am I supposed to do, chase down idiot smugglers all day long? Pass.
I hope not.
So, keep the war going? Do not fight too hard and win, but also do not offer peace. Good policy.
This isn't about forcing a surrender, or peaceful coexistence. My people will not stop until every system in the Republic flies an Imperial banner.
We'll erase the Republic.
That is a big job. The Republic has systems endless. We should be working, not talking.
Never say never. The Empire signed a treaty with the Republic before. It could happen again.
I hope peace is an option.
This makes me wonder what we do when there is peace and no one left to fight. Find another galaxy?
Mercy? Peace? I knew you were a primitive little savage, but I thought you might have learned something by now. Never ask that again.
You're a fool for even asking.
I will obey. No peace, no mercy--ever.
I learn what it means to be a warrior from you, Chief. You are a great teacher, and I will join you in victory. We go!
Something is bothering you.
When I said I did not miss my homeworld, I was wrong. I miss the food.
I have found no meal here that compares to caranak legs roasted over an open fire. My stomach rumbles just remembering them.
I have been curious to try the fish-head people. You call them Nautolans? I have not found one unspoiled. Maybe someday....
Even the Empire frowns on making a meal out of something that can form a complete sentence.
We don't eat other sapients.
You will not consume my body after I am dead? But I am not your people. There is no shame.
I didn't realize you ate your victims. How many intelligent species have you eaten?
Do you eat all your kills?
In your space? None yet. My people do not believe in wasting what nature provides us.
If you're that eager, we can always go hunting for a Nautolan. The Republic is full of them.
I'd be willing to get you one.
You have important work. The right meal comes, in time.
If I find good unspoiled Nautolan--or maybe Rodian--I will make a stew.
You will not make a stew out of another intelligent being--especially not aboard my ship. Do you understand me?
You are forbidden to do that.
Resources many are scarce in this war. What if the food runs out? But you are chief, and I obey.
Your barks and growls don't translate sarcasm very well. If this is a prank, you'd better say so.
Is this a practical joke?
I do not joke about food. I have gone hungry too often.
xxx
I highly recommend proper seasoning. Some meats can be a bit gamey.
Use plenty of spices.
I prefer natural flavor. Cooks here use too much salt. It is all I can taste.
xxx
I do not like to fight with an empty belly. How do you nourish your body for battle?
I only feed on what I take from my enemies--and I am always hungry for more.
Spoils of victory feed me.
I am the same. It is wasteful to leave an enemy on the battlefield.
A steady diet of my enemies' tears are quite sufficient to keep me satisfied.
Fear and terror feed me.
You eat only liquids? How did you grow so big on that?
When you wear this much armor, you need lots of muscle to keep moving. I get protein however I can.
Proteins keep me strong.
I am the same. Plants do not satisfy my hunger.
In my line of work, one cannot afford to be too picky. I was trained to be omnivorous to ensure my survival.
Survival is my top priority.
That is a good policy. I see why you are so strong.
I eat food that was grown in light, water and soil--not slaughtered beasts.
I eat only vegetables.
Only vegetables? How do you grow so big?
It doesn't matter. After this conversation, I have no plans to eat anything that was prepared by you.
Don't cook for me, ever.
I am sorry for you, Chief. After living so long alone, I am a great cook.
Too much talk about food makes me hungry. I will feel better after a good fight. We go?
Did you want to talk?
We have good journeys, Chief. Rewards many, battles endless. I do not miss my old homeworld. It had nothing left for me.
My tribe's people are soft and cowardly. They have no spirit. They feared me for being strong. I was not welcome in my village.
They didn't appreciate what makes you special, Treek--but I do. You've found your place in the galaxy.
You're welcome with me.
You are right. I am happiest here, Chief.
When people are afraid, you're doing something right.
It is good to be feared.
I believe the same.
You're an outcast. Get used to it and stop whining.
Don't ask me to cry for you.
I am not whining--I am grateful! I do not want to be welcome. Better to be feared.
You are a great hunter and respected warrior. Even the Sith fear you. I have seen it in their little yellow eyes.
Your Empire is a tribe of great warriors. You conquer all things in your path. The Republic will not stand against you.
I walked my homeworld for seasons many hunting my path to the stars. During the journey, I dreamed of an eternal warrior surrounded by fire. I think that was you.
I am a master of the Force, and everyone senses my power--even you on that distant world.
Yes, I have a destiny.
I thank fate for leading me to you.
Who am I to argue with your dreams? Let's just hope those flames were my enemies burning and not me.
Anything is possible.
No foe can break your armor.
Interesting. Remind me to have you tested for Force sensitivity--and psychosis, while we're at it. Nothing wrong with covering every possibility.
You're precognitive, or crazy.
I am not crazy. My dreams are true.
An eternal warrior surrounded by flames? That could be good or bad, depending on the context. Did you have any other dreams?
What else did you see?
No dreams I remember but that one. But do not fear. It was good.
It was only a dream. You probably ate some bad tree bark and had a nightmare.
I can't take you seriously.
I ate smoked bordok, dried geejaw wings and hakamat berries. No nightmares. My dreams were true.
I have had no better chief in my life. With you, I will conquer worlds and crush foes endless! Our legends will never fade!
I'm glad you feel that way, because we're not running out of battles to fight any time soon.
I appreciate your enthusiasm.
I am ready to fight--always and forever!
I can always count on you to cheer me up. Maybe I should make you my morale officer?
You're a good friend, Treek.
I would honor you with praise for no extra fee.
You know what they say about great legends... they all end with a heroic death. Are you prepared for that?
Just be ready to die for me.
Yes. I think about my legendary death always. I would like to go while destroying Coruscant.
These words make me hunger for a new fight. Lead me, Chief. We go!
You look cheerful today.
You are a good chief. We go to exciting planets and destroy interesting enemies many. This is a happy life.
My homeworld chief told me to stay in our village. I would cook and raise children like the other women. Instead, I left and walked across my planet. Legendary journey!
Your leader sensed you were special and feared your power. You are destined for better things.
You showed great strength.
I knew that truth even then. I do not regret my choice to leave.
Never let anyone tell you who you are or what you can be. We make our own destinies.
Always choose your own path.
Yes! You understand. The chief called me crazy as a geejaw. I knew better.
Good for you. People like us don't sit around cooking for ungrateful little womp rats. You're a natural-born hunter.
You made the right move.
Yes! My old chief saw only a woman. He had no vision.
Embarked on a bit of intelligence-gathering? Good for you--knowledge is power. Did you find anything interesting?
You did the right thing.
Yes. I found my true self.
I assumed underneath all that fur, you were a man. Are you actually female?
Wait, you're female?
Yes, I am female! How do you not notice this? I am highly attractive! Tribal men endless pursued my favor, but I wanted more.
I'm sure someone finds your life story fascinating. You should go find that person.
I'm already bored.
You did not let me finish. The walk was only the beginning!
My journey lasted seasons many. I saw my homeworld's wonders: Blurrg's Isle, the Desert of Salma, Lake Greetac. I hunted terrible beasts.
I warred with a Dulok tribe in the Sagreb Swamps. They regretted challenging me. I claimed Dulok ears for my necklace!
You took on a whole enemy tribe alone... and won? How did this happen?
Tell me about this war.
Duloks accused me of trespassing. They sent warriors to skin me. Big mistake. Duloks are tall, but thin. Their legs break easily.
What's a Dulok?
Dulok?
They are scaly, bony lizards. They have big ears and small brains. My homeworld does not miss their kind when they die.
Dulok ears, hmm? That's one trophy I'd like to see.
Show me the necklace.
I lost my necklace on Nar Shaddaa. A vrblther ate it. I took the vrblther's ears as a replacement. They are not as good.
My homeworld journeys left a mark that will not be forgotten. That is why I stay with the Empire. It understands why legacies matter.
Everywhere I look on Dromund Kaas, I see great monuments many. What mark will you leave behind when your end finally comes?
I will hunt down every Jedi in the galaxy until I've choked the life from the last pitiful member of their order.
I plan to destroy the Jedi.
To wipe out a chosen foe endless... this I will see done!
I'll be remembered as the greatest Emperor ever to rule the Sith. That'll do nicely, don't you agree?
I will be the most powerful.
That... is legendary. I am proud you are my chief.
If I do my job right, no other hunter will rack up as many bounties as me. That's legacy enough.
I'll always hold the record.
A trophy no other can possess, but will always be pursued? Yes!
It's in the nature of my work to cover my tracks. I'll leave a mark--but it shall be anonymous.
I'll remain an enigma.
That is unfair. You are a great hero. Others should know it.
I don't need a monument. If I can leave the galaxy a better place for having been here, that's enough.
The galaxy will be improved.
The best way to keep a legend alive is to make it a happy tale? That is a good policy.
The best way to make sure no one forgets you is to stay alive. If there's any way to cheat death, I'll find it.
Maybe I just won't die?
If you do not die, your legend has no end. It is incomplete forever.
I will create a song to honor your deeds. If you should ever fall, know that I will sing your legend to all who will hear.
This was a good talk, but it is time for more deeds. We go!
We will talk on the starship when you are ready, Chief.
We will show your foes what a legend is, Chief.
The Empire will conquer to glory. I am happy to join it.
Every journey with you leads to great rewards many.
To hunt, to conquer, to yield never... this is why I live.
I have come far since my homeworld. I will go even farther.
There is no better chief than you anywhere.
Today I woke hungry for challenges. Lead me to them.
Foes many underestimate me. I make them regret their mistake.
Where you leave, fear remains. That is a good policy. The survivors will remember.
I make songs of our journeys. The language is harsh--not easy to hear.
There is no greater happiness than knowing I have fought well and conquered all.
It is always an honor to follow you into battle.
Your foes are endless, but so is my thirst for great battles.
You lead, Chief. I go where you say.
If this war takes me to the stars endless, it is always worth fighting.
My tribe would not understand our tales, Chief. They are too legendary.
